trans-unit.source: How to Encode an Asset using Azure Media Encoder
trans-unit.target: How to Encode an Asset using Azure Media Encoder

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Media Encoder to encode media content on Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Media Encoder to encode media content on Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: How to encode an asset using Azure Media Encoder
trans-unit.target: How to encode an asset using Azure Media Encoder

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: REST
trans-unit.target: REST

trans-unit.source: .NET
trans-unit.target: .NET

trans-unit.source: Portal
trans-unit.target: Portal

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In order to deliver digital video over the internet you must compress the media.
trans-unit.target: In order to deliver digital video over the internet you must compress the media.

trans-unit.source: Digital video files are quite large and may be too big to deliver over the internet or for your customers’ devices to display properly.
trans-unit.target: Digital video files are quite large and may be too big to deliver over the internet or for your customers’ devices to display properly.

trans-unit.source: Encoding is the process of compressing video and audio so your customers can view your media.
trans-unit.target: Encoding is the process of compressing video and audio so your customers can view your media.

trans-unit.source: Encoding jobs are one of the most common processing operations in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Encoding jobs are one of the most common processing operations in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: You create encoding jobs to convert media files from one encoding to another.
trans-unit.target: You create encoding jobs to convert media files from one encoding to another.

trans-unit.source: When you encode, you can use the Media Services built-in Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: When you encode, you can use the Media Services built-in Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: You can also use an encoder provided by a Media Services partner; third party encoders are available through the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: You can also use an encoder provided by a Media Services partner; third party encoders are available through the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the details of encoding tasks by using preset strings defined for your encoder, or by using preset configuration files.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the details of encoding tasks by using preset strings defined for your encoder, or by using preset configuration files.

trans-unit.source: To see the types of presets that are available, see [Task Presets for Azure Media Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn619392.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To see the types of presets that are available, see [Task Presets for Azure Media Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn619392.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you used a third party encoder, you should [validate your files](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn750842.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you used a third party encoder, you should [validate your files](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn750842.aspx).

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to always encode your mezzanine files into an adaptive bitrate MP4 set and then convert the set to the desired format using the [Dynamic Packaging](media-services-dynamic-packaging-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to always encode your mezzanine files into an adaptive bitrate MP4 set and then convert the set to the desired format using the [Dynamic Packaging](media-services-dynamic-packaging-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you must first get at least one On-demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you must first get at least one On-demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale Media Services](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale Media Services](media-services-manage-origins.md#scale_streaming_endpoints).

trans-unit.source: If your output asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.
trans-unit.target: If your output asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Configuring asset delivery policy](media-services-dotnet-configure-asset-delivery-policy.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Configuring asset delivery policy](media-services-dotnet-configure-asset-delivery-policy.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a job with a single encoding task
trans-unit.target: Create a job with a single encoding task

trans-unit.source: When encoding with Azure Media Encoder, you can use task configuration presets specified [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn619389.aspx).
trans-unit.target: When encoding with Azure Media Encoder, you can use task configuration presets specified [here](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn619389.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Use Media Services SDK for .NET
trans-unit.target: Use Media Services SDK for .NET

trans-unit.source: The following **EncodeToAdaptiveBitrateMP4Set** method creates an encoding job and adds a single encoding task to the job.
trans-unit.target: The following **EncodeToAdaptiveBitrateMP4Set** method creates an encoding job and adds a single encoding task to the job.

trans-unit.source: The task uses "Azure Media Encoder" to encode to "H264 Adaptive Bitrate MP4 Set 720p".
trans-unit.target: The task uses "Azure Media Encoder" to encode to "H264 Adaptive Bitrate MP4 Set 720p".

trans-unit.source: Use Media Services SDK for .NET Extensions
trans-unit.target: Use Media Services SDK for .NET Extensions

trans-unit.source: Create a job with chained tasks
trans-unit.target: Create a job with chained tasks

trans-unit.source: In many application scenarios, developers want to create a series of processing tasks.
trans-unit.target: In many application scenarios, developers want to create a series of processing tasks.

trans-unit.source: In Media Services, you can create a series of chained tasks.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services, you can create a series of chained tasks.

trans-unit.source: Each task performs different processing steps and can use different media processors.
trans-unit.target: Each task performs different processing steps and can use different media processors.

trans-unit.source: The chained tasks can hand off an asset from one task to another, performing a linear sequence of tasks on the asset.
trans-unit.target: The chained tasks can hand off an asset from one task to another, performing a linear sequence of tasks on the asset.

trans-unit.source: However, the tasks performed in a job are not required to be in a sequence.
trans-unit.target: However, the tasks performed in a job are not required to be in a sequence.

trans-unit.source: When you create a chained task, the chained **ITask** objects are created in a single **IJob** object.
trans-unit.target: When you create a chained task, the chained **ITask** objects are created in a single **IJob** object.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] There is currently a limit of 30 tasks per job.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] There is currently a limit of 30 tasks per job.

trans-unit.source: If you need to chain more than 30 tasks, create more than one job to contain the tasks.
trans-unit.target: If you need to chain more than 30 tasks, create more than one job to contain the tasks.

trans-unit.source: The following **CreateChainedTaskEncodingJob** method creates a job that contains two chained tasks.
trans-unit.target: The following **CreateChainedTaskEncodingJob** method creates a job that contains two chained tasks.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the method returns a job that contains two output assets.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the method returns a job that contains two output assets.
